page.title: 10 Bindon and the Undercliff
page.content: Bordering the{Bindon estate}on the coast is the great landslip of 1839 when 20 acres of land slipped into the sea.The 800 acres of undercliff are now looked after by the Nature Conservancy.There is a beautiful footpath leading through,from Seaton to Lyme Regis. 32 acres of the Bindon Estate at{ {Spring Head}is an area of Special Scientific Interest.The water rises in the chalk so it is an alkalkine spring and over 24 different species of orchids can be found there. {Conservation}is an important issue in the Axe Valley.For instance,should the estuary and marshes be left as they are, or drained so there is more room for amenities, or should it be built on,whether it be houses,shops or factories?
